name: Driveshaft
description: Publish Google Drive files as JSON to S3

GOOGLE_APICLIENT_KEY.description: A public API key for Google API access

GOOGLE_APICLIENT_SERVICEACCOUNT.description: A path to, or JSON representation of, a service account JSON key

GOOGLE_APICLIENT_CLIENTSECRETS_INSTALLED.description: A path to, or JSON representation of, a native application / installed client secret JSON

GOOGLE_APICLIENT_FILESTORAGE.description: Optional cache location. For use with CLIENTSECRETS_INSTALLED.

GOOGLE_APICLIENT_CLIENTSECRETS_WEB.description: A path to, or JSON representation of, a web application client secret JSON

AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID.description: The access key of your Amazon AWS user or IAM accont

AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY.description: The secret key corresponding to your access key

AWS_REGION.description: The AWS region to use for S3

DRIVESHAFT_SETTINGS_AUTH_REQUIRED.description: If true, then successful client-side authentication will be required to access any page

DRIVESHAFT_SETTINGS_AUTH_DOMAIN.description: If specified, allows client-side authentication for users within the specified domain only

DRIVESHAFT_SETTINGS_MAX_VERSIONS.description: If set, only this number of versions of a file will be kept. Older versions will be removed.

DRIVESHAFT_SETTINGS_INDEX_KEY.description: The Google Drive key of a Google Spreadsheet that lists files and their destinations

DRIVESHAFT_SETTINGS_INDEX_DESTINATION.description: A url-formatted destination on S3 to which the configuration will be built (e.g., s3://BUCKET/PATH)
